8/9

Address: 316 S State St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Locally minded joint for casual dining, microbrews & cocktails in an open, airy brick interior.

parking: Somewhat difficult to find a space

summary.snippet: "Late lunch chop salad and chicken tacos delicious and service was great"
"Great place, super friendly laid back staff, great food, good happy hour."
"The onion rings were homemade and the corn beef was lean and tasty."

most_relevant.description: We stopped by Red Hawk Bar & Grill for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. It was quiet in the restaurant and the staff was friendly. They let us know of some recommendations and specials. The portions are large and the atmosphere is really relaxed. We enjoyed our meal and our walk downtown.
Great spot to gean a bite before an event. Staff was welcoming food terrific.

I ordered the Traditional Red Hawk Burger with Steak Fries and the Sweet Potato Fries. The burger came out exactly like I wanted, medium rare. It was tasty and the toppings were fresh. The steak fries weren't anything special but the sweet potato fries had a perfect crisp and paired very well with the chipotle-mayo. I also had the paloma drink here and the flavors didn't pop as much as I wanted it to but, still refreshing nonetheless. Overall experience was great and our waitress Elena was very nice.

Stopped in for a quick bite and was very pleased with my meal. The atmosphere is great and they offer a ton of seating. I ended up getting the Smoked Turkey Rueben which was so good and something I’ll definitely come back for. Their hand cut fries are also very good and I would recommend getting them with your meal. Price wise they are very fair as my sandwich with a side ended up being about fourteen dollars. Stop by and give them a try!
Amazing food options, and everything tasted great! One of the best burgers I've had in a long time, and the cheese curds are perfect. Great place for any occasion.

I just had the privilege of devouring the GUMBO of shrimp, chicken and andouille sausages at the Red Hawk. The combination of authenticity, simplicity and savoir-faire in this dish made me fall off my chair. The quality and freshness of the ingredients splashed off the plate and the masterful preparation - brilliant in its simplicity - did the rest. Not only delicious, but also healthy and satiating. Anyone looking for unadulterated quality without fuss, at a fair price in pleasant surroundings, knows where to go.
Great place to grab an evening bite in Ann Arbor. Decent service and food.  Establishment doesn't have a college town feel eventhough it's right in the middle.

We are local and this is our go to place. Good food, value, and the service is always great. Love this place. One pet peeve is that it is difficult to get good French fries anymore, they are frequently breaded and coated with chemicals. These fries are au natural!  Yum.
